name: Ancient
description:
600 BC - 500 AD

Greek and Roman philosophy, focused mainly on ethics, politics, and metaphysics.

name: Medieval
description:
500 AD - 1500 AD

Religious philosophy, merging faith and reason in Christian, Islamic, and Jewish thought.

name: Renaissance
description:
1500 AD - 1600 AD

Revival of classical thought, emphasizing humanism and reason.

name: Modern
description:
1600 AD - 1800 AD

The rise of Enlightenment ideas. Rationalism, empiricism, and critiques of knowledge.

name: Contemporary
description:
1800 AD - present

Diverse critical approaches to modernity, language, identity, and power.
